definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
to smell, look and taste great

sentences.english: I think Chinese food is perfect in color, aroma and taste.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得中餐菜真是色香味俱佳。

sentences.english: Does sniffing too many scents desensitize your nose?
sentences.chinese: 聞太多的香味你的鼻子會麻木？

sentences.english: With long-lasting fragrance, double your charm.
sentences.chinese: 香味幽長用後倍增迷人魅力。

sentences.english: Heat oil. Add Chng Kee's Sambal Belacan Chilli Paste and stir-fry until fragrant.
sentences.chinese: 用熱油翻炒莊記參芭芭拉煎辣椒醬至香味溢出。

sentences.english: The soap lathers up in an instant and gives off an expensive scent.
sentences.chinese: 這種肥皂會立即起泡並散發出高雅香味。

sentences.english: One could always feel fine smell of just-baked bread.
sentences.chinese: 顧客們始終能在麪包店裏聞到新鮮出爐的麪包香味。

sentences.english: No fragrance or scent masking agents.
sentences.chinese: 沒有香味或氣味遮蓋劑。

sentences.english: Lavender fragrance, a lighter is rather the role of god.
sentences.chinese: 薰衣草香味較淡，起到的是寧神的作用。

sentences.english: As he looked out, a fantastic smell came to his nose.
sentences.chinese: 當他伸出頭時，一股誘人的香味撲鼻而來。

sentences.english: A slight char is also apparent, creating a very enticing aroma.
sentences.chinese: 一種輕微的焦糊味創造了誘人的香味。

sentences.english: In Changshu, Jiangsu province, the chestnut trees and osmanthus trees are planted together, so the chestnut has the flavor of osmanthus.
sentences.chinese: 江蘇常熟慄樹與桂樹相伴生長，所產栗子有桂花香味。

sentences.english: Food-gradeessences can add very strange flavours indeed.
sentences.chinese: 加入食物香精的確獲得一種與衆不同的香味。

sentences.english: Lucky Charms changes what it does with every box.
sentences.chinese: 魅力幸運星香水用每一個盒子來改變它所顯示的香味。

sentences.english: With delicate fragrance, it can double your charm.
sentences.chinese: 香味幽長，用後倍增迷人魅力。

sentences.english: Although their juices had run dry， the leaves still exuded a pleasant aroma.
sentences.chinese: 儘管已乾枯，落葉仍散發出好聞的香味。

sentences.english: He was allured by the smell coming out of the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 他受到了來自廚房的香味的誘惑。

definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
